properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: The snow combined with strong winds will produce blizzard conditions over these regions. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-16T11:18:53-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-15T19:19:53-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0442703853.2020
Area: Inukjuak, Umiujaq
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winds gusting upwards of 100 kilometres per hour are occurring in this region. These winds will diminish through the night. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-16T11:13:43-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-15T19:14:43-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3117985771.2020
Area: Salluit
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow, at times heavy near Lake Superior on Monday. Snow will begin early Monday morning with snowfall amounts of 10 to 15 cm possible by Monday evening from Pic River to Wawa. From Wawa to Montreal River, similar snowfall amounts are possible by early Tuesday morning. The highest amounts are expected along the Lake Superior shoreline. Be prepared to adjust your driving with quickly changing and deteriorating travel conditions. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-16T18:07:39-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-16T02:08:39-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2633069757.2020
Area: White River - Dubreuilville, Wawa - Pukaskwa Park, Agawa - Lake Superior Park
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A cold front will pass through Baker Lake tonight bringing strengthening winds and falling temperatures in its wake. Blizzard conditions are likely to develop tonight. Blizzard or near blizzard conditions will be likely to continue through Monday and Monday night. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 6 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-16T19:54:07-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-16T03:55:07-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2806494950.2020
Area: Baker Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with poor visibility in snow and blowing snow are expected. Blizzard conditions will continue in Kugluktuk this evening with strong northwest winds gusting up to 80 km/h. Conditions are expected to improve near midnight tonight as the wind weakens. ### Travel is expected to be extremely hazardous due to reduced visibility. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-16T07:59:49-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-16T03:26:49-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1551575635.2020
Area: Kugluktuk
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Arctic outflow winds of 80 km/h gusting to 100 will continue to blow over southern sections of Howe Sound including Bowen Island late this morning. Winds are expected to ease near noon. Wind speeds will increase again tonight with northerly winds gusting to 80 km/h possible over southern sections of Howe Sound. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-16T09:49:10-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-15T17:50:10-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3202572941.2020
Area: Howe Sound
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with poor visibility in snow and blowing snow are expected. Blizzard conditions are expected to continue in Gjoa Haven and Taloyoak tonight as northeast winds gust up to 80 km/h. Conditions will improve early Monday morning when the winds weaken. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-16T16:59:38-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-16T03:23:38-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0471748056.2020
